website_summaries.verdict: A solid ultracompact, the SD770 IS nevertheless faces stiff competition from its closely priced line mates, the cheaper SD1100 IS and the better SD790 IS.
pros: Very nice photos for the price
cons: Some aspects of performance too slow

customer_reviews.title: Great product, durable and wonderful pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for several years now. I didn't realize that I never gave it a review until now. I LOVE this camera. We've bought a couple other Canon cameras this purchasing this one including a very nice SLR. This little camera remains my favorite. It's small and fits in my pocket which makes it the perfect vacation camera. It's super easy to use so if you ask someone to take your picture it's not a problem. It also has been very durable. Plus the thing takes great pictures. Granted not as nice as our SLR but that won't fit in my pants pocket either!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera, with faults
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera. Takes decent pictures. But the flash is anemic (don't use it for subjects more than 8 feet away) and doesn't like to be turned off. In fact, there doesn't appear to be a way to keep the flash off when using the camera in automatic mode. Each time you turn the camera on, it defaults to auto-flash (which usually produces poorly exposes pictures), so unless you remember to manually turn the flash off each time, you'll waste battery and get bad pix. The only way to override this is to set the camera to manual mode, where the flash-off setting will remain fixed until you turn the flash on. Really annoying. Otherwise, a very nice camera.
customer_reviews.author: LowRisk

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I got my husband this camera for Christmas. He loves it. He wanted a lightweight pocket-sized camera for hiking and documenting his woodworking projects. He has found it mostly intuitive to use and hasn't really found anything yet that he doesn't like about it. He really likes the fast response between pressing the button and taking the photo as we also own an older Sony that has a moment's delay that he finds annoying to use. He also likes the compact battery recharger. Perhaps best of all, the quality of photos he has taken so far has exceeded his expectations. As for me, I think the camera was a great price from Amazon at $159.00.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Small, sweet and power packed
customer_reviews.text: Its got all the features that a regular point-n-shoot user needs. Gets sought of grainy in the dark but with high ISO settings, the quality of the images gets pretty good. Sometimes you feel you could have more than just 3X zoom and that the LCD could be larger, but with a 160 buck price tag, no complaints from my side. I compared the quality of images (including low light conditions) with SD880 and G9, and surprisingly the SD770 did pretty good! (And they were much much better than Nikon Coolpix S550). The size, although small, might not be very convenient to take pictures sometimes (Need to get used to it). Overall, 5 *'s from me.
customer_reviews.author: Chandu

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Camera
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camera as an anniversary present and to give us more mobility when out and about with pictures. We have a Canon 30D DSLR and LOVE Canon products, but it was a little cumbersome to bring along. We took this on a trip to Disneyland and LOVED how portable it was. Takes great pictures, is fast and responsive (for a compact, not as fast as a DSLR), the screen is bright, and videos are surprisingly good. No complaints. For the price we paid ($144 on a gold box special) this was a GREAT buy. No "cons" or complaints.
customer_reviews.author: MS.UT

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This Camera takes great pictures. It is compact, portable and very reliable. Newer models may boast higher resolutions but you will not notice much difference unless you're a professional and in which case you should be looking at Canon pro series instead. For amateurs and casual users this canon is more than enough. The pictures can reveal incredible details. It may look small but it is powerful. Some of the pictures I took in the Detroit Auto Show look like Magazine Cut outs. This Camera is that good. I have owned it for a little over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Motown Doc

customer_reviews.title: SD770Is Canoon Point & Shoot Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have used this camera several times to take pictures to put unto Craig's List. So far, so good. It takes excellent pictures and is very easy to use (which I need lol). I LOVE the big screen compared to my old camera. Have not done alot of the things it has available yet, but so far I really am enjoying it and it is defintely worth the price I paid to have a camera that keeps the battery for a long time. My other camera is a good camera but I would be taking pictures and it would just die on me. I would recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: ALM

customer_reviews.title: Cannon SD 770 IS
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I got this camera over Christmas holidays and have been very pleased with it so far performs as expected , maco shots are also very clear and impressive for the price appears to be worth what i paid and a solid little camera. I have big hands so needed the strap because it is kinda small but was aware of this defintely a compact type camera and also since have gotten a case with screen protecter since receiving the camera I read the reviews as well before buying and is all I expected it would be , very pleased with.
customer_reviews.author: C T

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING CAMERA!!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this camera. I love taking pictures on vacations and blowing them up to frame..and this camera's high quality photos are perfect for that. The camera itself is so small, light, and easy to use..so it's also perfect for slipping in my clutch to bring out at night. I have NEVER seen a camera with such a long battery life- it's unbelievable! I have used mine for a month, taking about 1,000 photos and a few videos, and it STILL has 3 out of 3 battery bars. I can't get over that. I highly recommend this camera for anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia D. Green

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Pictures When Flash Activated!
customer_reviews.text: Quite by accident - just playing around with my new camera - I realized that when the flash is activated and you have it set on AUTO, you can't get a blurry picture! I've sat here spinning the camera around while taking picture after picture and every picture is clear and Not blurry at all. This is amazing to me. I've never had this with any camera in the past. I look forward to trying action shots to see how that will work, although most action shots, at least indoors, aren't in a situation where you can use a flash.
customer_reviews.author: M Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Still love after more than 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased Dec. 2008 and now after more than 2 years, still loving this little camera! Still takes crisp, clean images and is so easy to use. Part of the battery door compartment broke the other day but the battery door still locks in place so I will keep on using it. This is simply a great point and shoot camera with good battery life. Every once and a while I check out the reviews for the newest Canon model available but I still love this camera so much I'm sticking with it.
customer_reviews.author: Redhead Designer,

customer_reviews.title: my favorite digital camera yet
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this Canon for my own use and printed pictures out for Christmas...the pictures turned out clear, crisp and the bect quality that I've seen in any of my previous digital cameras. The screen in large enough to share and the camera is compact enough that I carry it in my purse so it's with me at all times. I have been able to crop, change the color etc. all on the camera without needing a computer editing program. I recommend this camera to anyone, it's very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper524

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the second PowerShot I've had, the first being the SD1000. I loved that first camera into the ground so I got this one as an upgrade. While there are a few tweaks, it's pretty much the same camera and that's all I really wanted. The only thing I dislike about this camera is that you can't turn the flash down. :: Edit :: After taking some time and figuring the camera out, it turns out that through the manual setting you can take really great indoor pictures, so there's really nothing bad about the camera! For the price it's a great digital camera that you can take with you everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pictures and movies.
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed that such a small camera can take such good pictures. There are so many features packed into it, but for the most part you can just leave it on auto and get good shots. The best thing about this is the size. I have two kids, and we have enough stuff to lug around when we goto the park or the zoo and my old camera was just getting to heavy to hang around my neck. This camera easily slipped into my front pants pocket! So far, very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. M. Volk

customer_reviews.title: Good Point and Shoot Camera, No Raw, No Bracketing
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic point and shoot camera, In my first shipment battery and wrist strap were missing, Amazon send a quick replacement. I appreciate their customer service, This makes me buy more things on Amazon. Camera is awesome, video is great without any lag, Photos were crisp and clear, I felt picture is little burr with superfine setting, i am fine with "Fine setting". No Raw shooting and bracketing, i felt these should be mandatory on all the camera's( Canon At least), those who don't understand these no need to worry. I hope canon will release the firmware for these settings. Over all this is Best point and shoot camera for $159.
customer_reviews.author: sira

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera two or three months. I have no complaints. It starts up really fast. It is ready to take pictures two seconds after pressing the "On" button. Colors are rendered accurately. The image stabilizer works. This camera really is the size of a deck of cards. Mine is made in Japan and has excellent buid quality. I have the siver and black one. It looks much better in person than the silver one. I am very happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: J. Allred

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: The last camera that I liked was a Canon. I tried others because they were cheaper or seemed to have more features but was disappointed. I had a Pentax that didn't take good picutures and their customer service wasn't into serving the customer. My Sanyo Xacti stopped working a month after the warrantee ended. I'm back with Canon now. Great pictures, fast startup, good battery, great features, small. Thanks Canon, it's good to be home.
customer_reviews.author: Pw Henderson

customer_reviews.title: A Wonder!
customer_reviews.text: Canon had really out done themselves with this camera. It's incredibly small, yet full of features. The two main things that I love about this camera are: 1) The extremely responsive LCD display & menu system. It doesn't have any lag/delay, even while indoors, and the display is bright enough to view outside in direct sunlight. 2) The built in red-eye correction really does the job! And if the camera didn't detect the red eye automatically, you can go into the camera's menu and remove the red eye yourself. Very handy! What else can I say? I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Too Good To Get a New One
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Canon Powershot for so many years now. I'm thinking it's been maybe 6 years or more. It's probasly time for me to get another but I am having a hard time even thinking about a new one.It's just the right size and does just what I want so I guess there's really no reason to get another.Very reasonable and still works very good. It transfews my pictures to my computer very good too.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot SD770
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my wife, however I am the one who has to figure out how to use it. I must say the camera can do much more than I will ever use or remember. The instruction booklet is very well illustrated and easy to use. I did not realize how much of a difference 10mp would make over my 3mp until I was able to view them side by side, WOW!!! I have purchased many items from Amazon and have never been disappointed with the products or delivery. Always is what they say it is and always delivered on or before the scheduled date.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for a few years now and for a small compact camera, it does a great job. The picture quality is great for having a small camera. The charge doesn't take too long. I bought an extra battery just in case we needed it and it's come in handy when we've forgotten to charge the battery that's in the camera. Over all I think it's excellent for the price and I would recommend getting one.
customer_reviews.author: JCSMITH

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Im a point and shoot beginner...but do know what a clean crisp picture should look like on a digital camera..and so far this camera delivers. Colors come out well..the camera is a good size..has a sturdy feel and has just about everything one would need in order to take a good picture as their are alot of options which allow you to take the kind of picture you need in any particular siituation. For me an overall good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a camera I continue to use all the time. If I buy a new one, it's still a canon powershot. I love it. Takes good pics and the camera is easy to take with you anywhere.We did buy an underwater case to go with it. I just can't find a waterproof one I like enough yet that is supposed to take good pics.
customer_reviews.author: Oceanlvr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very awesome camera. Bought it to replace my lost Kodak Easy Share from a few years ago and I'm very impressed. It has much better picture quality, starts up in no time (my Kodak took a good 5 seconds to be ready to shoot), and is lighter from not having AA batteries in it. It's smaller than my iPhone, so it definitely qualifies as compact! I can't wait to get a lot of use out of this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I don't know about the price (better here then anywhere else I found it) but it sure does what it's suppose to do. The picture quality is pretty good and the different parts of the camera is decently sturdy. Have had bad experiences with other cameras that fall apart on me because of bad engineering of the parts such as the zoom feature, the button used for taking the picture and the lens. I like this product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great all around camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip around South America and couldn't be happier with how it worked. Excellent battery life, fair amount of options for those who don't have much experience taking pictures and the quality of the pictures were consistently good. Especially like the fact that it easily fit in my pockets and the fact that the battery charger had the plug built into it, therefore not requiring a separate cord. Camera also records decent video. For an all around camera, I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Locke

customer_reviews.title: Best Powershot ever!
customer_reviews.text: I'd owned this camera for about the past 5 years. It was stolen in October when I was in Albuquerque. I could not afford a new one so I bought this one used. I also use a larger Canon EOS Rebel, but this particular camera is so easy to take when I go out with friends or just go out on a nature excursion. It takes WONDERFUL pictures. I really enjoy the micro lens on it as well. Would recommend it highly. Seller was very timely as well and followed up to make sure that I received it on time.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kay

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much I can add to the already great reviews on this fantastic product, but I will try. Fit, function, and feel of this camera is all top notch. Service from Amazon was great and I have no complaints. Searching the web I found this camera slightly cheaper elsewhere, but with overcharged shipping and handling fees it brought the price in line with what Amazon was charging with free shipping. The only recommendation I have for people purchasing this product is to find a clear screen protector for the LCD. The screen gets very smudged with finger prints. Surprisingly the screen doesn't come with even a cheapy thin one out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Hyer

customer_reviews.title: Close to perfect powershot
customer_reviews.text: After reading a various amount of reviews for the different 10MP - this was a great choice. Point and click! Love it. I started taking pictures without any additional set up and the pictures have come out VERY clear and colors are vivid. This is not pocket slender, but close. I give this 4 of 5 stars only because I wished the optical zoom was better than 3x. Otherwise, a great find/buy!
customer_reviews.author: CaliLuv

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: This Camera is amazing. It was straight out of the box, point and click, ready to go. It takes great pictures. It is perfect for someone like me that just wants to point and click and have the camera do the work. I love it. The price on Amazon was a great deal !!!! The size of the camera is a real plus also. It fits in your purse, you hardly know it is there.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda H

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera, and needless to say my family and friends love it too. My sisters have two different Nikon cool pix cameras and my mom has a sony. This camera by far comes out with the best pictures, and a little tweaking in Photoshop makes them perfect. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone because it is also pretty easy to figure out :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tiny package, unbelievable quality
customer_reviews.text: It is almost unbelievable the quality of this camera for this price. And the pictures it takes are gorgeous. If you want to enjoy your family outings, sightseeing or birdwatching without having to drag around a big bulky heavy camera, yet want great - GREAT - pictures, get one of these cameras. Awesome quality for the price and convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Kateyras

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD770IS
customer_reviews.text: Had a Kodak will never go back. It started acting up witin 18 months. This has features I am still exploring and find very easy to manipulate. Could not believe the picture of the full moon taken with the telescopic feature at night. It was something that you would have that had been taken by an expert (not me) with and high powered SLR.
customer_reviews.author: I. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and awesome
customer_reviews.text: I just received the SD770 and I love it. I had considered the 1100 but jumped on the 770 as it was only several dollars more. The 770 is actually smaller than the 1100 and performs just as well. Picture quality is top notch, startup and shutdown is quick and it looks nice in black and silver. A few differences are the 10MP vs 8MP, the slight size/weight drop of the 770, the color schemes of the 1100, and more importantly, the better battery life on the 770. If the price difference is still negligible here on amazon I'd say you can't go wrong with the 770.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary West

customer_reviews.title: Good quality photos but not totally intuitive process
customer_reviews.text: The camera is good but i did have to rely on the instructions quite a bit plus the memory card was ridiculous in size. I could barely get 10 shots on there so had to go back and order another memory card. I also had trouble getting Butterfly to respond to emails. I think my next electronics purchases will be done in person.
customer_reviews.author: DC barb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a previous model that I loved! I took it with me everywhere and it finally died. So I got this one, and it is every bit as good. It is everything I want in a little point-and-shoot digital camera. I put a screen protector on this one because I noticed the screen getting scuffed and scratched on my other one during my rock climbing, backpacking, and other daily and high adventures. But a reliable, perfect little camera!
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Terrific point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my wife to use for taking photos of our new baby. After having this camera recommended by a friend I picked it up on Amazon.com. The camera feels and looks solid and has a bright large LCD screen on the back. The camera is dummy proof and takes sharp images with out any manual adjustments. My only complaint is that it uses proprietary batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD770IS
customer_reviews.text: I used a few friends older SD canon models and like them. They were happy with them, so I bought a new one for myself. So far I love it, pix are great and camera couldn't be easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Walter W

customer_reviews.title: Love a digital ELF
customer_reviews.text: Love a digital ELF... rechargeable batteries, great little camera to take pics or video of family and friends - clear pics, good quality for the everyday person...
customer_reviews.author: Sycamore124

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: My Kodak CX7430 ate two AA batterys for every 10 shot and my Samsung MiniDV stoped working after three years. So I bought this SD770IS to replace the old two,and it exceeds my expectations. The battery seems to last forever, I have taken maybe over 200 pictures and altogether 1 hour video, all indoor, sometimes with flash, and the low battery warning didn't show up until today. The video is just great, much better quality than a video camera. The two things I don't like: the video takes up more than 100M for every 1 minite, and the red eye light is very annoying and doesn't seem to work.
customer_reviews.author: Allentown

customer_reviews.title: Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my teenage daughter who loves to take pictures of all her friends. Her biggest complaint with earlier camera was the speed and battery. This uses a rechargeable battery, and resets for rapid fire photos so she can take lots of action shots of her friends without waiting between flashes.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel N. OConnor

customer_reviews.title: I got this on 2008. That's right!! ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this on 2008. That's right!!! after 7 years, the camera still works! :) forgot to mention it's 2015 now!
customer_reviews.author: Miky T

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: After buying the wife the Canon 1100, I was impressed and had to replace my Canon 540 for the smaller model ,got the SD770 ,Great compact and more features and haven't seen it cheaper than I paid here at Amazon . If you get the HC SD card spend a bit more and get the SD 6 ,which is the faster card.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the purchase overall
customer_reviews.text: SD770 matches my expection. Slim, sliver, light enough to put inside of pocket. The image quality is good, easy to use. One thing that I don't like is that it's not good to take picture of moving kids, especially inside the door; couldn't compete with my canon SLR EOS. But it's very good for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Holy Newland

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic small point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a 5 star even though I've only had it about a week. I returned 2 before this one (Sony and Kodak). This one is far superior in noise reduction and overall image quality. The noise I have seen has been more fuzz than the color noise that I've seen with other point and shoots. The features are amazing and include a function button, a grid if desired, histogram, IS throughout all modes - not just a designated mode as I've seen on other models, plus many more. The picture quality is excellent for this type of camera. Battery charges quickly and it turns on very quickly. Well worth the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy camera
customer_reviews.text: I still use this camera years later. It has taken many sharp pictures. It is durable, and the battery life is good.
customer_reviews.author: Lins Turnbow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is nearly perfect for a non tech person like me. The cost is extremely reasonable and the directions in the manual and on the camera are simple and intuitive. The software is easy to use although photo manipulation, enhancement, and saving seemed easier with my old Canon Zoom Browser and PhotoStitch. This camera, its battery and SD cards are very light and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bortnick

customer_reviews.title: another winner
customer_reviews.text: Fast, small, image stabilization, face recognition, lots of extras for a point and shoot. Another winner in the Elf format. Only drawback is the limited 3X optical zoom. Great camera for the money. I started with the SD230, then the SD630 and then this SD770. A really nice camera in the progression.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised.
customer_reviews.text: I choose this model to replace a Panasonic Lumix of a few years because of its much smaller size. The camera works as advertised. It is easier to use than the Lumix, lighter and more versatile. I am still on the learning curve but can heartily recommend it to anyone wanting a highly portable camera.
customer_reviews.author: Martin J. Coady

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the average user
customer_reviews.text: * Takes solid shots * Never anything blurry * Easy to use * The "auto" feature that figures out what the best setting is, is a blessing * perfect for family outings, in-ings * perfect for people like my teenage sister who love to take pictures of themselves...haaaaaaaa
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for Low Price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for the price. I got it to replace another canon that I lost. The battery life on this thing is absolutely incredible. It literally lasted through a few couple days of taking many pictures and videos and with very frequent playback from an enthusiastic 7 year old. It takes GREAT pictures in bright sunny light and with flash. That said, the quality in lower light is good (good to good+) but not great (at least while using it handheld on automatic settings, I'm sure manually set and on a tripod it would be excellent). For a point and shoot this is a superb choice.
customer_reviews.author: Demian Dellinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I purchased the Canon Powershot SD770. I was torn between the SD790 and the SD770. I am very happy with my purchase! At the time the two cameras were about $30 apart in price but I read reviews that said the battery life in the SD790 wasn't as great due to the increased size of the viewing screen. I had a Canon Powershot SD400 before so the SD770 already provided a larger viewing screen than I was used too. The camera is excellent quality and the pictures come out fantastic plus the battery life is great! Canon is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: A. Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Canon 770 IS, exactly as ordered
customer_reviews.text: For anyone thinking about ordering this camera, it is amazing what they have put into such a small package. Included in the deal was a 4 gig sd card. All products were as advertised, and the free delivery came a day earlier than promised. There seems to be a lot of choices to pick from when using the menu, and that might take awhile for me, my attention span is shorter than a puppy. As of this moment, I am really glad I ordered this camera and glad I ordered it from Amazon. The best price, great service, and quick and free delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Robert Ross

customer_reviews.title: better then the G9 for jpgs
customer_reviews.text: This sensor is updated and has excellent quality at iso 100, 200 and even 400. Better then the G9 shooting jpgs. Just shoot at the custom level with sharpness, satuation and contrast turned down and then fix it in photoshop if you want the best quality. Of course it doesn't have the manual features of the G9 but then I would use a small DSLR anyways. It Has a METAL body !! I don't know why some say it's plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis H. Laska

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great camera always used it and can take pics and video..
customer_reviews.author: Rex Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very well built camera (better than the SD1100 a friend has) that does everything quite well in my limited experience with it. It's amazing that it cost me less than half what my 4 year old Canon A95 did, and has twice the resolution and is less than half the size!
customer_reviews.author: Warren Cortesi

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for 5 years and it works great. Have never had any issues with the shutter, images, etc. It works as if I had bought it yesterday. Photos are sharp, the camera is lightweight, fits well in pockets/purse, and is aesthetically appealing. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It's tiny enough to fit in my smallest purse and takes beautiful pictures. The red eye corrector works much better on this camera than any of my previous ones. It is also very easy to use. I'm no pro, I just take pictures of friends when I'm out... fits my needs perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: megmegjo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value
customer_reviews.text: I relied on the other reviews to decide whether or not I wanted to invest in this product. Amazon was having a special one day, and I decided to take the plunge. I'm very grateful I did. I have an old Canon Elph and have loved it, but I'm going on a dream trip to Italy this fall and wanted to update it. The improvements they have made over the years and the increase in megapixels are amazing. Still it retains it's tiny size, convenience and lightness for traipsing all over Europe. The pictures are amazing. I can't wait to use it on my trip!
customer_reviews.author: Laura V.

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: A professional may find fault in this camera, but I can't. A lot of research led me to the canon, but I was sceptical if a camera that small could take good pictures. Well, the pictures were great! I also found it had a few less "scene" settings than my old Nikon, but the Auto setting on the canon is so good that I rarely need to find a different setting. My old camera had re-chargeable AA's and I am so glad I bought one with the Lithium Ion. Amazon's great price plus Great pictures equals a great camera for me. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ross

customer_reviews.title: I'm delighted!!
customer_reviews.text: I had done some shopping before realizing that Amazon offered the best price on the camera I desired. Service was excellent - I received the camera VERY quickly, using the basic option. And what an excellent camera it is. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ratila

customer_reviews.title: Better than most Point-and-Shoot at this price
customer_reviews.text: Relatively good picture quality. My old Canon point-and-shoot has RAW, wish this one has it too. Viewfinder a bit tiny but still better than none at all. Very light and makes for a very good pocket camera where you do not want to lug along a bulky DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Canon is the best
customer_reviews.text: As usual, Canon makes a great camera at a great price. This camera is easy to use and has way more features than I could ever hope to use. The instruction manual alone is a few hundred pages, which is daunting when all you want is a simple point-and-shoot camera, but the beauty of this is that it works as a simple camera and yet does almost anything you can ask for. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Babbitt

customer_reviews.title: Snapping Great Shots
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my purchase of the Canon Powershot SD 770 IS. I am happy with the features of the camera and the service I received. The only negative would be the very small memory on the memory card that came with the camera. Fortunately I had a memory card from my previous Canon that was compatable that had much more memory. I am enjoying my new camera and taking many pics.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley A. Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Photos are better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how sharp the photos are on this camera. The detail is superb. It took me awhile to discover all the setting options, such as one for snow, but once I did my winter shots are the best I've seen. This camera is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: R. Hammock

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight, Eady to hold, Clear shots
customer_reviews.text: This is my third digital camera and the lightest weight, smallest size with the best shot. I a case for the camera. The Canon cases do not work so well. I ended up buying a sony case for my camera. I have a 2 1/2 year old that most cameras only catch the back of her - I niw get great face shots.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Walsur

customer_reviews.title: must have!!!!
customer_reviews.text: the most amazing camera ive ever owned! it takes the most spectacular pictures and its so small! I always get compliments on the picture quality and my sister who is a professional photographer recommended it to me. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: shopgirl

customer_reviews.title: can't go wrong with canon
customer_reviews.text: bought this canon to replace my wifes old canon. this is smaller but with a larger lcd screen. never had a problem with her old canon, so i decided to stick with canon and got her the sd770. you can't go wrong with canon, you may find cheaper cameras, but if you want great picture quality go with canon. i bought this for her this past christmas (2008) for 159.00 and free shipping. not sure why the price has gone up, usually prices go down with electronics and the cheapest i have seen this camera now is 199.00.
customer_reviews.author: schonrph

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this camera except the zoom and the slow shutter. When it comes to taking pictures it's too close and doesn't zoom out too far either. The zoom works better while videoing but I rarely use that, I am more into taking pictures. When I am rushing like taking pictures from the moving car the shutter wouldn't allow me to take it fast unless I leave it on but the battery life is great, so I can leave it on to take fast snaps.
customer_reviews.author: HPfan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Have used it a lot in the last 2 years and it's been great. Great photos and very pocket friendly. I lost the little strap so I dropped it and the battery compartment door broke, but it's still fine.
customer_reviews.author: I. Patcherezov

customer_reviews.title: Travel Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera fora trip to Peru. It is light weight, fairly small and takes excellent pictures. Zoom works well for thosse distance shots.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size camera
customer_reviews.text: I recently went on vacation and used this camera instead of my much larger, heavier camera. It was so much more convienent to just slip this camera into my pocket and go. It was great. I was able to pull it out at moments notice and get the shots I wanted. It was great. The only problem I had was when the batteries started to get low. I did miss a few shots because the camera didn't flash as quickly as it did when the batteries were at full charge. But the pictures were great.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera.
customer_reviews.text: I am still using this camera. Most cams are now 16mpx. This one is 10mpx. But it makes great pix, very sharp. Not much else to say, just a great little cam.
customer_reviews.author: SeeAndSay

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful colors, sharp images
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful colors thanks to the DIGIC III processors, sharp images, needs very little post-processing. On the flipside very little manual control and virtually zero depth-of-field tricks even in portrait or macro modes. Fair battery usage and the stabilized lens helps in night-photography. Overall a very good slim point and shoot, though if you want a bit more control or you plan to be a bit more serious about photography, go for the A590. It's cheaper and better.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera in 2008 as a Christmas gift for my wife. It's still going strong, and taking great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Chet

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: I have have been using the camera for over a month mostly in closed places like clubs. Over 95% of the pictures come out very good. The only thing I have against this camera is the red eye. Even though it is set to fix it it self it doesn't. I have to manually change it myself.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gjylameti

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera!!! I carry it in my purse all the time. It takes great pictures and the image stabilizer works great. My husband has problems with his hands shaking while shooting and the camera corrects this. I can't recommend this camera enough. It is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: great pictures
customer_reviews.text: I loved this camera. It is small,portable, and ready for action. Too bad it is very sensitive to white sand. I ruined by camera
customer_reviews.author: suspense

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Canon and I've loved all of them. I upgraded to the 770 and can tell the difference the Image Stability makes. Its small size and lightweight so I can carry it with me all the time.
customer_reviews.author: wrgagirl

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: It was time for us to upgrade, and I looked at alot of different cameras. I decided I wanted something with options but could use it in just an automatic mode, and something compact. I narrowed it down to Canons. This camera is lovely. It takes clear, beautiful pictures. It was very easy to figure out. The screen is nice and big to view pictures. It is easy to turn the flash on and off. It isn't bigger than a stack of cards. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Megan B. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is an up-grade from sd1000, the extra features worth it... 10 megapixels, plus the digital image stabilizer, not to mention the ISO 3200 option. It is a well rounded camera (Cannon reputation) at under $160.
customer_reviews.author: Andy D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good camera, good quality pictures. and the sdhc cards are inexpensive versus others like sony or olympus. It's my second canon digital camera and I'm glad.
customer_reviews.author: Arnoldo L. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: malfunction after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: The button stopped working to snap pictures or recharge after about a year.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: This Camera Rocks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I've always used a Canon. I must say that I'm a big guy and I didn't think this particular model would be so small but I still love it. Takes quick pics and they always come out perfect. Great camera for great price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Garan

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, good deal!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second camera of this type we have bought. We got this one for our daughter and she loves it. Ease of use and small enough to fit into her purse. Love the Canon cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Judy D. Ussery

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I have the SD 800 and my son and daughter-in-law loved the pictures I took. I got them the 770 and I think the pictures are even better than on my 800. This was their favorite gift.
customer_reviews.author: Pam K

customer_reviews.title: A great compact camera
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with the Canon SD770IS. I wanted a camera that would fit easily in 'girl jean pockets' and it does. The controls are intuitive and I have yet to read the manual. The construction feels solid and the startup time is negligible. Overall I am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Jutsum

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD770
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Camera as a Christmas Gift for my Daughter. Small, lightweight and easy to use, she loves it! I love the fact that I get more photos of my Grandsons!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, takes great pictures. The 32G card only holds about 9 photos, but that's because its 10 megapixels. It's probably more camera than I needed, but it's fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Love Canon - and this camera lives up to high expectations
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very easy to use, takes great pictures and I absolutely love it! Especially for the great deal that I got from AMAZON!!! Thanks, Amazon! Angel
customer_reviews.author: A. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: No problems. Just as advertised. Its very small. A couple test pics in medium light was a little grainy when viewing the picture at full resolution, so I'm not sure whats going on there. I tried to take a picture while moving the camera, and sure enought it still takes blurry photos which I assumed was a thing of the past is the "IS" technology.
customer_reviews.author: cmk1523

customer_reviews.title: This was a good camera ...
customer_reviews.text: Canon is the one of the best. This camera was a good buy at the time. It took great pictures & was a good size. I gave it as a Christmas gift & they loved it.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera!
customer_reviews.text: It is very versatile. Its size makes it convenient. Many options. I gave it to my husband for Christmas. He loves it. He carries it everywhere, even on his runs.
customer_reviews.author: Jude

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: I am using this Camera since 3 years and it rocks... very good quality for the price. I think it is the best among its peers....very happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: iajarmeh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pictures in a samll package
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a camera that took great pictures but was small enough to slip into my pocket (so that I would actually take it with me!). This camera really fits the bill. I'm taking more pictures then ever (short videos too!) and the quality is fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.author: John Dittmar

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures & Compact Size
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great pictures. It is also easy to use and very small (wife carries it in a pocket in her purse). She loves it. It was also highly rated on steves-digicams website.
customer_reviews.author: MacFan

customer_reviews.title: Cannon Elph Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. I like that it is small to carry in my purse. It has taken great pictures. I am very happy with it...still checking out some of the features though.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa

customer_reviews.title: Good mobile camera
customer_reviews.text: positives: it's a great mobile camera, easy to carry, zoom is OK, easy to use and make settings. negatives: Though it says it has image stabilization, the pictures will have chromatic abberation or distortion if the camera is shaken while taking pictures. If the pictures are taken properly without shaking the camera, its a great one for a great price
customer_reviews.author: NiK

customer_reviews.title: Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality camera. Although, only 3x zoom. could use 4 or 5x zoom. 10 MP gives very detail pictures. Great camera. Would recommend highly. Fast Shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: lights camera action
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this camera for a couple of weeks and taken a few pictures. All have turned out very well. Like most new electronic devices this has more preprogramed options in it than I will ever use. It will take a while to learn how to activate the few modes I will want to use. Other than that I am very satisfied with the picture quality. It is almost idiot proof.
customer_reviews.author: Gary McKay

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SD770IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackCanon 2600b001 10.0 megapixel powershot sd770is (black)10.0 megapixel digital elph; 2.5" purecolor lcd ii screen for bright, accurate color with great viewing from a wide range of angles; packed with a powerful 3x optical zoom lens & optical image stabilizer to reduce blurry images; improved face detection technology sets the focus, exposure, flash & white balance automatically, allowing greater freedom of shooting before, during & after taking the image; motion detection technology automatically detects subject movement & optimizes exposure control & iso settings to reduce image blur; digic iii image processor for superior image quality & improved functionality; print/share button for easy direct printing & downloading; features id photo print & movie print with select pixma photo printers & selphy compact photo printers;black.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Instantly recognizable, the classic "Box & Circle" ELPH design lives on in the PowerShot SD770 IS Digital ELPH. This sleek, slim head-turner is the perfect everyday camera. High-end specifications include 10.0-megapixel resolution and a 3x optical zoom lens. Spectacular images are easy to create thanks to advanced Canon technologies like Face Detection and Motion Detection Technologies that eliminate blur. 

PowerShot SD770IS Highlights 



1x zoom/3x zoom 3x optical zoom and Optical Image Stabilizer The PowerShot SD770 IS Digital ELPH’s 3x optical zoom is a clear winner when it comes to getting up close and personal. And Canon’s invaluable Optical Image Stabilizer reduces the blur of camera movement, even in tricky low light situations. 

2.5-inch PureColor LCD II screen for bright, accurate color The PowerShot SD770 IS Digital ELPH gives you a large 2.5-inch LCD screen for excellent control when framing your shots. Canon’s PureColor LCD II offers more spectacular color, resolution and contrast even when viewed at an angle (compared to PureColor LCD). The screen is highly durable and easy to see in any light with a scratch-resistant, anti-reflective coating. It also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light -- a perfect feature for gathering friends and family around to see your images. 

Motion Detection Technology automatically detects subject movement and optimizes exposure control Life doesn’t stand still for picture-taking. That’s why Canon included its advanced Motion Detection Technology in the PowerShot SD770 IS Digital ELPH. This sophisticated feature works in the background to instantly evaluate how fast your subject is moving. Then it automatically selects and sets the optimal exposure and ISO settings to keep everything looking sharp and clear. When you need higher ISOs for action-stopping shutter speeds, Motion Detection Technology provides it. But when no movement is detected, it allows lower ISOs for excellent color and detail. So whether you’re shooting a bride walking down the aisle, a ballet recital or even a child’s soccer game, you can relax and shoot with confidence knowing you’ve got the picture you intended. 

With Canon's Face Detection WB (right), skin tones are not affected by overall lighting Improved Face Detection Technology sets the focus, exposure, flash and white balance automatically Canon's powerful Face Detection Technology delivers even better results with the new SD770 IS Digital ELPH. The Face Detection Technology continues to recognize faces in a scene, and concentrate exposure (daylight or flash) and focus upon them. But the SD770 IS Digital ELPH adds more: Face Detection WB means the camera concentrates upon faces when calculating white balance for the best possible skin tones. Face Select and Track lets the SD770 IS Digital ELPH user highlight one face among several in a scene, and the camera concentrates on that person, even as they move around the scene. Face Detection Technology is a powerful contributing factor in Canon's new Motion Detection Technology. 

DIGIC III Image Processor for superior image quality and improved functionality With DIGIC III, your images boast superior quality, the camera operates at top efficiency and battery life is enhanced. What’s more, DIGIC III enables Canon’s Face Detection Technology and Red-eye Correction to give you better, more true-to-life people shots. Simply press the Shutter Button halfway down, and the camera automatically pinpoints the faces in the scene and chooses the ideal focus point. The camera controls exposure settings and flash to keep every face looking bright and natural. Red-eye Correction can be handled in-camera, in two ways. The entirely new Red-eye Correction during shooting uses the Face Detection Technology to recognize and remove red-eye from flash images as they're taken, before the file is written to the memory card. It's also possible to correct red-eye during image playback, using simple settings in the SD770 IS Digital ELPH's menu. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the fast DIGIC III Image Processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

Red-eye Correction provides three options for removing red-eye from subjects in flash pictures. 
1) The new Red-eye Correction during shooting actually identifies and corrects red-eye in human subjects as pictures are taken.
2) The SD770 IS Digital ELPH can be set to automatically detect and correct red-eye during image playback.
3) The user can manually locate any red eyes in a scene during image playback on the LCD screen, and command the camera to remove them. 

Print/Share Button for easy direct printing and downloading The PowerShot SD770 IS Digital ELPH's Print/Share button makes direct printing easier than ever. Simply connect the SD770 IS Digital ELPH to a Canon PIXMA photo printer or SELPHY compact photo printer or any PictBridge compatible photo printer, press the lighted Print/Share button and print! Also use the Print/Share button to transfer images to a computer (Windows and Macintosh). 

Print your own ID photos in 28 different sizes or use the Movie Print function to output multiple stills from a recorded movie on a single sheet with a Canon SELPHY compact photo printer.
feature_bullets: 10-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality poster-size prints
2.5-inch PureColor LCD II screen for bright, accurate color and wide viewing angle
Face Detection; Motion Detection Technology automatically reduces blur
Captures images to SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus memory cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars450 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
